documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
e.It is vacuous
if self-sealing, false if not.
One way of challenging a self-sealing position is to ask what possible
fact could prove it wrong. This is a good question to ask, but it can be mis-
understood and met with the triumphant reply: “Nothing can prove my
position wrong, because it is right.” A better way to show the insignificance
